column4: i messed up, i just typed: sudo iptables --table nat --append POSTROUTING --jump MASQUERADE  --source 192.168.0.0/24            ..... how do i remove that?
how do i undo what i just did with iptables?
i thought the ~/.profile wasn't read by gnome?
iv'e been reading that i should set it in Xsessions.d .. i have ubuntu 8.10
not really sure... work from cli most of the time ;)

it's something to set the directory or file structure so you can't modify anhything in thta folder.. it isn't perms, it's like perms though.  i swear i know it exists becaues i've used it - and now i have to use it agian to unlock what i've done.
try with user agent switcher for firefox ? ( a extension )
